clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Protein Supplementation Following Non-bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial of Oral Protein Supplementation Following Non-bariatric Abdominal Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators performed a randomized controlled trial of 62 patients undergoing elective abdominal operations. The treatment group was provided a liquid protein supplement and instructed to take a dose three times daily for the first 20 postoperative days. Investigators followed patients for six months and compared wound healing and changes in weight and laboratory values.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Mean preoperative weight compared to mean postoperative weight at each follow-up appointment. Weight recorded in pounds, subsequent measurements at each postoperative point were normalized to the preoperative weight and reported as a relative percentage of the preoperative weight.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall wound healing was documented on a scale of 0-2 (0 for unhealed, 1 for partially healed, 2 for completely healed). A wound was considered partially healed if there was any portion of the wound which had epidermal edges that were not in direct contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in white blood cell count (1x10 3/ uL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in white blood cell count relative to preoperative white blood cell count, calculated as absolute change

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total protein at each follow-up point relative to preoperative total protein, calculated as absolute change

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in albumin at each follow-up point relative to preoperative albumin, calculated as absolute change

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative, and then postoperative at 1-2 weeks, 3 weeks, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in prealbumin at each follow-up point relative to preoperative prealbumin, calculated as absolute change

arm_group.description: The patients in the control group did not receive any supplementation, and were directed to follow the dietary guidelines of their surgeon.

Patients were instructed to consume one ounce (containing 16 grams of protein) of the supplement three times daily. No other modifications were made to the patient's diet. Patients were provided with a total of 60 doses, which would last 20 days if they consumed each dose as instructed.

intervention.description: Prostat AWC- patients received protein supplementation after surgery
Placebo- Patients did not take any protein supplementation after surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients scheduled to undergo abdominal surgery [cholecystectomy, ventral hernia repair, colectomy, non-bariatric gastric surgery, appendectomy, small bowel resection, lysis of adhesions, liver resection, splenectomy, proctectomy, stoma construction, pancreatic surgery, duodenal surgery, adrenal surgery, renal surgery, or cystectomy]
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years
- Pregnant
- Abdominal surgery within the past 6 months
- Inability to attend follow-up appointments for at least 6 months
- Liver failure (Child-Pugh Class B or C) or kidney failure (glomerular filtration rate (GFR) less than 30).
